channel.title: Benchsci Job Postings
channel.description: Job postings for Benchsci from lever.co

item.title: VP, Product Management
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a VP, Product Management, a scientist with a proven track record of successfully building complex B2B data products catering to pharmaceutical companies and their scientists. This role will be reporting to the SVP, Science & Product. You are a team player, a great communicator, and enjoy customer-facing interactions; you can clearly articulate a clear vision, and help translate it into digestible chunks of work for cross-functional teams to execute. This is a challenging, impactful and highly collaborative role, situated at the intersection of data engineering, machine learning and bioinformatics on the one hand, and a deep understanding of science, and bench scientists and how to cater to them on the other hand.

item.title: Technical Lead, Data (Remote)
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a Technical Lead - Data to join our growing Data team! Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will evolve our data models, operationalize production-grade data pipelines, and contribute to our document mining/information retrieval initiatives as we expand our ability to extract valuable insights from scientific publications and databases.
You will get to lead specific data projects that directly contribute to our client's understanding of drug discovery research. This is a fit for you if you excel at pulling meaningful insights from data, love making an impact and want to share your technical creativity and expertise with the folks around you. The technical lead role is a unique expansion of the scope of a Senior Data engineer that takes on multiple facets of technical leadership, team building, and defining our technical roadmap.

item.title: Technical Lead - ML Engineering (Remote)
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are seeking a Technical Lead - ML Engineering to join our growing R&D team! Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will run our end-to-end machine learning platform, from research to production ML models. Successful candidates for this role are well-versed with the nuances of the machine learning lifecycle and have a clear approach to measure the improvement of our ML systems and their peers’ workflows. The technical lead role is a unique expansion of the scope of a Senior ML engineer that takes on various facets of technical leadership, team building, and building out our technical roadmap. You can expect to collaborate with your ML teammates as well as folks from MLOps, Data, and Science teams.

If you are the sort of engineer with a deep interest in how cloud architecture actually works under the hood, you’re exactly who we’re looking for in this role. item.title: Software Engineer - Security (Remote)
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a Security Engineer to join our growing Infrastructure & Security team! Reporting to the team’s Engineering Manager, you will help validate that BenchSci's services are implemented to the highest security standards. You will also analyze the security of applications and services, build security automation, set up processes to drive principles of accountability and secure-by-design, and quickly react to new threat scenarios. Importantly, you will take the lead on security-related matters and help us to ensure that all classified client data is kept confidential.

We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are currently seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing Core Services, System Reliability Engineering team! Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you'll apply your technical and domain expertise to solve complex technical and business challenges; participate in design discussions, code reviews, and project-related team meetings; and work with other engineers to develop innovative solutions that meet business needs concerning functionality, performance, observability, scalability, and reliability.

item.title: Security Analyst (Remote)
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a Security Analyst to join our Governance, Risk, and Compliance Team. You will report to the Director, Governance, Risk, Compliance and Privacy.
The Governance Risk and Compliance team ensures that BenchSci is operating effectively and protecting our interests. As we have grown and added tools and vendors, our risk level has increased. The security analyst ensures that BenchSci maintains a strong security posture and that we continue to follow our compliance requirements as we continue to expand and ramp up our offerings.
As a security analyst at BenchSci, you will provide assurance to us that the processes we have developed follow industry best practices and are monitored. You will respond to requests around client and industry certification audits as well as, investigate alerts generated by monitoring tools and/ or threats surfaced through NIST or other industry sources.
Your role at BenchSci is collaborative as you work across the organization to help investigate potential issues that may arise and help asses new vendors, partners, and tools. Understanding the risk associated with potential issues means that you will also draft security and compliance briefs.

item.title: Director of Data Engineering
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a seasoned Director of Data Engineering, who lives and breathes tackling data challenges to join our growing team. This is a challenging, impactful, and highly collaborative position. Reporting to the Sr. Director of Data Engineering, Machine learning, and Bioinformatics, you will be responsible for spearheading our Data ingestion and modeling initiatives, working across a wide variety of biomedical data, and helping the team to extract scientific insights. You will help the teams to translate the platform vision and define the direction to build, validate, productionize, and maintain BenchSci’s Data Pipeline. You will play a highly collaborative role to bring together the various projects data is involved in, including working BenchSci’s Machine Learning teams, Bioinformatics team, R&D team, and our teams of scientists.

item.title: Chief of Staff, Culture (Remote)
item.description:
BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
We are looking for a Chief of Staff, Culture to join our Culture Stream (People, DEI, Coaching, Internal Communications) to report and support our Chief People Officer (CPO). You will work with the Chief People Officer but also with the Culture-stream leadership team and the broader company extended leadership and serves as a trusted partner, being a force multiplier to get twice as much done for the CPO and stream overall.
You are someone who has a strong quantitative analytic mind to do descriptive analysis, takes pride in operational excellence, and can be an advisor on strategic matters. This is not an executive assistant position, but an operations and strategy role with experience with hands-on getting-things-that-matter-done.
Your role will be divided into two parts. The first part includes structured work around operations of the culture stream (reporting, OKRs, culture stream weekly and monthly meetings, and communications). The second part includes working on special projects as they come up. These projects will be areas that the Chief People Officer is interested in driving forward but lacks the capacity to do so, which may include supporting teams in codifying their culture, revamping our culture listening tour approach, and researching the future of work best practices.
